title: Making all research work visible
description: This is a lightning talk I gave for the QUEST Center virtual brainstorm on "The future of scholarly communication: A virtual brainstorming discussion between early career researchers and scientific publishers" (2023-01-04). Specifically, this is a brief talk about ResearchEquals's principles. This is the first time I am making a presentation in the new iA Presenter software - you can find the original file as a supporting file in case you'd like to reuse this.

workspace.bio: My research focuses on how the publishing system can facilitate improved quality of scholarly research. In particular, my research  explores modular publishing systems that break a research project into its building blocks. These building blocks are then sharing continuously and in chronological order, to provide a more accurate depiction of the research journey. I am currently director of the organization Liberate Science GmbH to implement this research finding into practice, and develop the practical use of it within a diverse set of research communities.

children.title: ResearchEquals Lightning Talk @ Exploring the potential of alternative publishing models (JISC workshop)
children.description: This is a lightning talk I gave for a JISC led workshop on "Exploring the potential of alternative publishing models" (2023-01-19). This was a closed session, with attendance of pro-vice-chancellors from UK Universities. I presented the ResearchEquals community with the following slides, with the goal of encouraging them to share it with their constituent junior researchers. The target group of the session is policymakers at UK universities, so I wanted to make sure to reach our core target groups (junior researchers, librarians). I again use the new iA Presenter software - you can find the original file as a supporting file in case you'd like to reuse this (unzip it and open it).

workspace.bio: Admirer of Nature in all its facets. Not the journal and, yes, with a capital N. Skeptic. Particularly about considering humans and their endeavors as disconnected/superior/inferior from/to Nature. I don't think we are scientists studying Nature, but rather Nature studying itself (changes some perspectives). I don't think we need to conserve biodiversity (as if it was an external object) but we are biodiversity striving to conserve itself (although it often doesn't looks like it). Still don't have a clear definition of the ambiguous term Natural Product. Fascinated by historical, contemporary and future means deployed by humans to learn about his cohabitants on the branches of the tree of Life (particularly non-mammals). Fascinated by the analog/digital facets of Nature. See this interesting post by Freeman Dyson https://www.edge.org/conversation/freeman_dyson-is-life-analog-or-digital. Interested in exploring the potentialities of digital tools for the understanding of Nature. Drafting stuff. Not good at finishing them.
